title: Verify backward compatibility with existing URLs
description:
Test that archive-list can process URLs from existing archlist files.

**Test coverage:**
- URLs from actual archlist (real user data)
- Various GitHub URL formats (with .git, different branches if supported)
- GitLab.com URLs
- HuggingFace model URLs
- Codeberg repository URLs

**Verify:**
1. ProviderFactory extracts domain correctly from all URL formats
2. Strategy discovery finds working approach for each provider
3. README content is downloaded successfully
4. Error handling works for invalid URLs or missing READMEs

Run a subset of actual archlist URLs to ensure migration from old providers didn't break anything.

title: Reset logic and timezone handling
description:
Implement reset timestamp parsing and timezone-aware reset behavior.

Tasks:
- Parse reset timestamps from headers (Unix epoch or ISO 8601)
- Convert to UTC timezone (handle non-Z timezones)
- Implement reset check: if now > reset_at, reset remaining to limit
- Store reset_at per-token if provider supports per-token resets
- Handle different timestamp formats per provider

Using chrono for robust timezone handling.

title: Add logging for strategy discovery attempts
description:
Add debug logging to Provider's strategy discovery algorithm.

**Add logs for:**
- When trying cached strategy (working_strategy hit/miss)
- When falling back to trying all strategies
- Each strategy attempt with strategy name and URL
- Strategy success (which one worked)
- Strategy failure with error reason

**Location:**
src/provider/generic.rs in Provider::get_readme_url()

Use log::debug! for detailed strategy discovery information to help debug provider behavior across different domains.

title: Implement rate interval subsystem
description: Implement rate interval subsystem using governor with 1.5x velocity and 2s time-base

title: Lazy strategy discovery and caching
description:
Implement lazy strategy discovery with fallback and retry logic.

Tasks:
- Implement strategy discovery algorithm: try each strategy in order
- Cache working strategy in Provider for subsequent calls
- Add strategy retry: clear cached strategy if it fails, try remaining
- Add logging for strategy discovery attempts and results
- Handle strategy-specific errors appropriately
- Implement strategy cloning for caching

title: Test two-tier rate limiting
description:
Verify rate limiting behavior works correctly.

Tests:
- Verify round-robin rotation works with multiple tokens
- Test rate limit handling across reset boundaries
- Test error scenarios (invalid tokens, exhausted tokens)
- Test governor prevents burst behavior after reset
- Test header decoder normalizes headers correctly
- Run cargo clippy and fix all warnings

title: Implement GitHub provider
description: Implement GitHub provider with async detection and rate limit header parsing

title: Define Provider trait
description: Define Provider trait with async detect() method and rate limiters. Basic trait exists but needs detect() method for URL provider detection.

title: Token management: loading, validation, and selection
description:
Implement token lifecycle management for rate limiting.

Tasks:
- Load tokens from environment variables (comma-separated)
- Implement token validation via lightweight API call
- Parse rate limit headers from validation response
- Implement round-robin token selection (skip invalid/exhausted tokens)
- Handle revalidation when all tokens exhausted

Environment variables: GITHUB_TOKEN, GITLAB_TOKEN, HUGGINGFACE_TOKEN, CODEBERG_TOKEN

title: Implement reverse buffer reader
description: Implement reverse file reader with 4k-aligned buffer reads from file end, tracking lines read from bottom. Already implemented in util/reader.rs with 4096-byte chunk size and proper handling of incomplete first buffer.

title: Setup Cargo.toml dependencies
description: Initialize Cargo.toml with clap, clap_complete, tokio, anyhow, reqwest, governor, config, directories crates

title: Core provider infrastructure
description:
Create core data structures and strategy trait for generic provider system.

Tasks:
- Create Strategy trait with: name(), get_readme_url(), get_url()
- Implement basic strategies: ApiStrategy, RawGitStrategy, HtmlScrapeStrategy
- Create DomainConfig struct with: env_var, api_pattern, rate_limit_headers
- Create Provider struct (not GenericProvider) with: domain, rate_limiter, strategies, working_strategy
- Create ProviderFactory with hardcoded domains (GitHub, GitLab, HuggingFace)
- Define RateLimitHeaders and TimestampFormat for domain config

title: Implement failure logging
description: Create failure logging to .fail file with URL and error code format. Already implemented in failure.rs with format: "<URL> <ERROR-CODE>"

title: Fast rate limiting with governor
description:
Implement per-second rate limiting to spread load across reset interval.

Tasks:
- Configure governor RateLimiter per provider with velocity multiplier
- Velocity allows faster-than-realtime rate (e.g., 1.5x) until API limit hit
- Prevents burst behavior when reset occurs
- Works in conjunction with header-based slow rate limiting

This is a two-tier system: governor (fast) + headers (slow).

title: Extensibility and custom domains
description:
Add extensibility features for custom domains and additional strategies.

Tasks:
- Support custom domain configuration via environment variable (ARCHIVE_LIST_DOMAINS)
- Add more strategies: GraphQLStrategy, ScrapeTreeStrategy
- Add strategy prioritization (some strategies preferred over others)
- Add metrics/tracking for strategy success rates
- Add config file support for domain configuration (YAML/TOML)
- Add provider mocking for testing with mock strategies

title: Implement basic CLI parsing
description: Implement CLI entry point with clap derive parser for readme-get command. Already implemented in cli.rs with clap derive. Add completion generation.

title: Implement GitLab provider
description: Implement GitLab provider with async detection and rate limiting

title: Core Utilities
description: Implement core utility modules: position tracking, reverse buffer reader, failure logging
acceptance_criteria:
- src/util/mod.rs with exports
- src/util/reader.rs with position tracking + 4k-aligned reverse buffer reader
- src/failure.rs for .fail file logging
- Async config position updates every 2s

title: Implement basic readme-get command
description: Implement readme-get command to download READMEs maintaining URL directory structure

title: Implement Codeberg provider
description: Implement Codeberg provider with async detection and rate limiting

title: readme-get Command
description: Implement the readme-get command to download READMEs from repos in archlist
acceptance_criteria:
- src/commands/readme_get.rs module
- Processes archlist from bottom to top
- Downloads READMEs maintaining URL structure
- Creates directories for repos without README
- Supports --top-down, --refresh flags

title: Rate Limiting
description: Implement rate interval subsystem using governor crate with provider-specific limits
acceptance_criteria:
- src/util/ratelimit.rs module
- Governor configured at 1.5x velocity, 2s time-base
- is_ok() checks against provider rate limits
- Stops when provider credits exhausted

title: Integration with existing codebase
description:
Integrate generic provider system into existing codebase, replacing hardcoded providers.

Tasks:
- Update Provider trait to use generic Provider internally
- Update readme_get.rs to use ProviderFactory instead of detect()
- Remove hardcoded provider files (github.rs, gitlab.rs, huggingface.rs, codeberg.rs)
- Update provider_selector.rs to use ProviderFactory
- Ensure backward compatibility for existing URLs
- Add integration tests for common domains

title: ProviderFactory implementation
description:
Implement ProviderFactory for creating and caching providers.

Tasks:
- ProviderFactory holds domain configuration map and provider cache
- Implement domain extraction from URLs (parse URL, extract host)
- Implement get_provider() method with caching (RwLock<HashMap>)
- Wire up RateLimiter to Provider
- Load tokens from domain config per domain
- Configure rate limit headers per domain

title: Implement config management
description: Implement config file management using directories crate to locate config and config crate to parse. Already implemented in config.rs with ProjectDirs, ConfigBuilder, and serde.

title: Generic provider with strategy pattern
description:
Implement a generic provider system using the strategy pattern, replacing hardcoded provider implementations.

ADR: doc/adr/0002-generic-provider-with-strategy-pattern.md

Key features:
- Single GenericProvider that works for any domain
- Strategy pattern for different README fetching techniques
- Lazy strategy discovery (try strategies until one works)
- Domain registry for configuration and auth token mapping
- DomainProvider factory for creating domain-specific providers
- Integration with two-tier rate limiting system

This replaces hardcoded GitHub, GitLab, HuggingFace, Codeberg providers with a unified system.

title: Update all providers with rate limiting
description:
Integrate rate limiting into all provider implementations.

Tasks (shared across GitHub, GitLab, HuggingFace, Codeberg):
- Implement fetch_url() method with rate limiter integration
- Parse provider-specific rate limit headers using common decoder
- Update remaining/limit/reset_at from response headers
- Handle rate limit errors (403, 429) with sleep until reset
- Add governor checks before making requests

GitHub headers: x-ratelimit-remaining, x-ratelimit-limit, x-ratelimit-reset
GitLab headers: RateLimit-Remaining, RateLimit-Limit, RateLimit-Reset
HuggingFace headers: X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Reset
Codeberg: same as GitLab

title: Integrate rate limiting into readme_get command
description:
Update readme_get command to use new rate-limited fetch_url method.

Tasks:
- Change from get_readme() to fetch_url() for URL fetching
- Handle rate limit errors with proper retry/backoff
- Ensure directory structure creation still works on failures
- Update error handling to surface rate limit issues clearly

title: Provider System
description: Implement provider trait with async detection and rate limiters for GitHub/GitLab/HuggingFace/Codeberg
acceptance_criteria:
- src/provider/mod.rs with Provider trait
- Async detect(url) -> Option<Box<dyn Provider>>
- Async rate limiter per provider
- GitHub implementation with rate limit headers
- GitLab, HuggingFace, Codeberg implementations

title: Add position tracking
description: Add position tracking as lines from bottom, integrate with reverse buffer reader

title: Clean up ProviderWrapper after direct integration
description:
Remove ProviderWrapper adapter once readme_get.rs uses ProviderFactory directly.

**After completing "Update readme_get.rs to use ProviderFactory directly":**

Remove from src/util/provider_selector.rs:
- ProviderWrapper struct definition
- detect_provider() function (move to read_me_get.rs or keep factory-only wrapper)

Update imports and references in codebase.

This is cleanup work - the adapter served as compatibility layer during migration but is no longer needed once direct ProviderFactory integration is complete.

title: Core rate limiting infrastructure
description:
Create the core data structures and utilities for token-aware rate limiting.

Tasks:
- Create Token struct with: value, valid, remaining, limit, reset_at
- Create RateLimiter struct with: tokens Vec, round-robin index, env_var_name
- Implement common header decoder: convert to lowercase, strip leading "x-"
- Add chrono dependency to Cargo.toml for timezone handling

All structures should support lazy initialization (start uninitialized).

title: Add readme-get flags
description: Add --top-down and --refresh flags to readme-get command. Already implemented in cli.rs:20-27

title: Add rate limit validation
description: Add is_ok() method to check against provider rate limits before allowing requests

title: Config Management
description: Implement config file management using directories and config crates
acceptance_criteria:
- src/config.rs module
- Uses directories crate for config location
- Uses config crate for config parsing
- Stores lines_from_bottom position
- Async writer updates every 2s

title: Implement HuggingFace provider
description: Implement HuggingFace provider with async detection and rate limiting

title: Add async position sync to config
description: Store lines_from_bottom position in config and set up async writer to update every 2s

title: Create source directory structure
description: Create src/ directory structure: main.rs, cli.rs, commands/, provider/, util/

title: Project Setup
description: Set up basic Rust CLI scaffolding with dependencies and project structure
acceptance_criteria:
- Cargo.toml with all dependencies configured
- Basic src/ directory structure created
- CLI entry point with clap
- README updated with installation instructions

title: Two-tier rate limiting
description:
Implement a comprehensive rate limiting system with header-based tracking and governor-based fast rate limiting.

Epic ADR: doc/adr/0001-providers-and-rate-limits.md

Key features:
- Token-aware rate limiting with multiple tokens per provider
- Header-based rate limit tracking (remaining, limit, reset_at)
- Round-robin token rotation across available tokens
- Common header decoder (lowercase, strip x- prefix)
- Fast rate limiting with governor (per-second limit with velocity)
- Timezone-aware reset timestamp handling
- Lazy initialization

title: Update Provider trait interface
description:
Rename methods and add new fetch_url method to Provider trait.

Tasks:
- Rename get_readme() â†’ get_readme_url() in trait
- Add fetch_url() method to trait (makes authenticated request with rate limiting)
- Update all existing providers to implement renamed get_readme_url()
- Add chrono dependency if not already added
